description: Dive into "Chasing Cascades: Kanchanaburi's Waterfall Wonders" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chasing Cascades: Kanchanaburi's Waterfall Wonders

places.generalDescription: Sai Yok Noi Waterfall, also known as Khao Pang Waterfall, is a popular natural attraction in Kanchanaburi province. While it may not be as well-known as Erawan National Park, it offers a budget-friendly alternative for nature lovers. The waterfall is located about two kilometers from Sai Yok Noi waterfalls and provides a picturesque setting for swimming and relaxation.

sources.snippet: The Sai Yok Noi Waterfall, also called Khao Pung, is located 48 kilometers northwest of Kanchanaburi. It is less touristy than the Erawan Falls and sees even fewer tourists than the Sai Yok Yai Waterfall. The best time to visit this waterfall is in the wet season from June to October.
sources.shortName: 13 Amazing Things to do in Kanchanaburi Province

sources.snippet: The Erawan Waterfalls in the Erawan National Park, the Sai Yok Noi Falls, the Sai Yok Yai Falls and the Huay Mae Khamin falls are a must visit among the many others present in Kanchanaburi.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Waterfalls of Kanchanaburi in Thailand

sources.snippet: It's not nearly as beautiful as Erawan, but it does offer a great way to observe Thai families doing what they do best - eating gourmet picnics!
sources.shortName: WWII and Waterfalls in Kanchanaburi

places.name: Sai Yok Noi Waterfall (Khao Pang Waterfall)

reviews.text:
A beautiful oasis of nature in an area otherwise known for its shockingly brutal past. There is a railway cutting directly adjacent to the waterfall, and this area is also just next to Nam Tok station.

The water is easily accessible, suitable for anyone, and very beautiful to look at. You can also climb the rocks to get close and stand under the waterfall.

Nice waterfall, really beautiful. Would definitely give 5 stars because it was a really wonderful experience. However, it was so crowded, a bit dangerous as it's extremely slippery. And it was quite difficult to park.

I booked a train tour on SRT to go here (Special train Sai Yok Noi - 150 baht). I highly recommend this method if you have time and want to explore this place with a reasonable price. The trip length is 12 hours, 6:30-19:30. You can discover a historic railroad situated on a side of mountains. The waterfall doesn't have much clean water in this season, so it's good to rent a carpet and picnic. Good picnic place.

places.address: 63Q5+F8M, Tha Sao, Sai Yok District, Kanchanaburi 71150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Erawan National Park is a renowned destination featuring tiered waterfalls, picturesque hiking trails, and opportunities for nature exploration and swimming. The park is home to the iconic Bridge over the Kwai River, a significant relic from World War II. Visitors can also pay their respects at the Kanchanaburi War Cemetery and admire the panoramic views from Wat Tham Sua temple.

sources.snippet: One of the most popular destinations is Erawan National Park, home to the spectacular seven-tiered Erawan Waterfall. Guided waterfall tours in Kanchanaburi provide an opportunity for visitors to explore these natural wonders while immersing themselves in the lush surroundings. Tourists can trek through the park's verdant trails, passing by emerald pools and cascading waterfalls, with opportunities to swim in the crystal-clear waters and admire the diverse flora and fauna along the way.
sources.shortName: The Best Waterfall Tours in Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: It settles in Erawan National Park, Si Sawat district in Kanchanaburi about 500 meters from the national park office. With its height that varies between 100 ‚Äì 400 meters, Erawan Waterfall, which falls into a series of cascades down towards the river Kwai Yai in the area of the park office. The clear water splashes down over the 7 steps of limestone with 1,500 m of distance from the lowest tier to the top.
sources.shortName: Erawan Waterfall - Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: In this guide, we want to tell you everything we know about visiting Erawan Waterfall on a day trip from Kanchanaburi. We‚Äôre going to share information about the opening hours and entrance fees, how to get there from Kanchanaburi/Bangkok with bus, with motorbike or with a tour group, and we‚Äôll share our own experience hiking and swimming in Erawan Waterfall.
sources.shortName: How to Visit Erawan Waterfall on a Day Trip in 2024

sources.snippet: This National park is a home for some of nature‚Äôs most beautiful attractions. among them, there is one hotspot which is not only a Kanchanaburi attraction but also one of the most famous destinations in the itinerary of a Thailand vacation. Considered to be the most beautiful waterfall in Thailand this cascading beauty is a real treasure.
sources.shortName: What to do in Kanchanaburi? - Top 10 Attractions

sources.snippet: The most spectacular natural formation in Kanchanaburi are the Erawan Waterfalls which lie within the Erawan National Park. The river cascades down the side of a hill forming a set of seven waterfalls that are connected by deep blue plunge pools. These pools are the natural habitat of the dead skin eating fish.
sources.shortName: Erawan Waterfalls Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: Erawan Falls is located in Erawan National Park in Kanchanaburi. It is said to be the most beautiful set of waterfalls in all of Thailand. I don‚Äôt know about that as I still have a few to see before I can pass my personal judgment but it was certainly worth the trip.
sources.shortName: Erawan Falls - Erawan National Park

sources.snippet: Erawan National Park boasts seven tiers of watery adventury for 200B/pp. Hike to the top and make your way down for the 4pm bus back. Each level has something different, but the flesh eating fish (the ones we think are used in fish spas) are ever-present!
sources.shortName: WWII and Waterfalls in Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: Because Erawan Falls are inside Erawan National Park, there is a fee of 300 baht ($10-ish) per person to enter. However, it is so very worth it. You can spend up to all day or a few hours in this park and that money is so worth it.
sources.shortName: Erawan Falls - Kanchanaburi, Thailand

sources.snippet: After begrudgingly paying the ‚Äúhigh‚Äù entrance fee (300 Thai Baht per person), we entered Erawan National Park on our motorbike. This waterfall has got to be really something, we thought.
sources.shortName: Erawan Falls, Kanchanaburi: Jungle Swimming

sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal Thailand - Things To Do In Bangkok
sources.shortName: 7-Level Waterfall In Kanchanaburi With A Limestone Cave

places.name: Erawan National Park

reviews.text:
Amazing place, loved trekking here. The water is cold which feels amazing in the scorching sun.It is definitely a must-visit for nature lovers and adventure seekers. The 7-tier waterfall of just 2000m makes for a fun and manageable trek, and the cool, clear water is a perfect reward after the hike to the top. But, nothing beats a refreshing dip in those emerald like pools on a hot summer day.
The well-maintained & nicely laid out paths and stairs also make it accessible for most people, though the higher levels can still be a bit of a challenge for some.

Walking up the waterfalls in Erawan National Park was one of the most beautiful expeditions I did in Thailand. Everything is well maintained, and it was not too crowded.
Even though I didn't see any monkeys, some signs were warning about monkeys that might try to steal some belongings at some parts.
You will find endlessly beautiful sceneries to make pictures and video clips.
Don't think. Just go and enjoy.

A great place to visit for a hike and swim. Wear good water shoes and dress light. If you want some intense exercise go to waterfall floor 7 first then come down and visit the other waterfall pools. Hike isn't challenging for average people but it does have steep sections, you climb up to 700 metres I believe.

places.address: 94GV+5HW, Tha Kradan, Si Sawat District, Kanchanaburi 71250, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Erawan Waterfall, located in the Erawan National Park in Kanchanaburi, Thailand, is a popular destination for backpackers and nature enthusiasts. This seven-tiered waterfall cascades through the lush rainforest, offering a picturesque setting for visitors to explore. The lower tiers are easily accessible from the entrance, while reaching the upper tiers requires more effort as the trail becomes more challenging. Swimming is allowed in some of the pools, providing a refreshing experience amidst natural surroundings.

sources.snippet: Our best advice is that if you want the Erawan Waterfall Trail, then you should do the hike early in the morning. That way, it will be less sweaty, less crowded, and you get to experience the jungle waking up.
sources.shortName: How to Visit Erawan Waterfall on a Day Trip in 2024

places.name: Erawan Waterfall (Level 7)

reviews.text: The 7th level is truly stunning! Crystal-clear emerald water, refreshing scenery, and cool water. Clear directions and plenty of cozy spots to sit and chill - definitely worth the hike!

Many levels Beautiful Waterfall. To reach the last Waterfall Level 7 was an arduous hike. Be prepared to bring some water if you do it in the afternoon scorching sun. Level 7 does not require a life jacket as the water level is only about four feet deep.

It's one of the great national parks in Thailand that you should visit. It's very beautiful and quite exhausting, haha. The entrance fee is expensive for foreigners but very cheap for Thais. It's definitely worth visiting. The place is peaceful with a great atmosphere. I visited during winter (winter for Thai people üòÇ) and the weather was absolutely amazing!

places.address: 945R+HCM, Tha Kradan, Si Sawat District, Kanchanaburi 71250, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Erawan Falls, located in Erawan National Park, is a stunning waterfall consisting of seven tiers that can be accessed through scenic trails and footbridges. The natural beauty of the park and the falls is open for everyone to enjoy, with additional activities such as visiting the Sri Nakharin Dam Golf Course available for those seeking more adventure. The area also offers various accommodation options and is surrounded by picturesque landscapes, making it an ideal destination for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Erawan Falls is one of the most magnificent waterfalls in Thailand. With its stunning layers of cascades, the clear blue water, and over 7 levels for us to explore, it is not hard to see why the people considered it as it is so. Since Erawan Falls is 65 km away from Kanchanaburi City, the drive there with a scooter will take you about 1.5 hours and so I recommend you start your day as early as possible.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Kanchanaburi and where to stay

sources.snippet: These gorgeous waterfalls are located about 70km/44miles outside of Kanchanaburi, but a must-see on any trip there. Erawan Falls are a series of seven magnificent waterfalls that flow down into beautiful turquoise pool where you can find dozens of tourists cooling off from the insane humidity. Matt and I both being major nature lovers, we knew this was a must-visit!
sources.shortName: Erawan Falls - Kanchanaburi, Thailand

sources.snippet: Few places we‚Äôve seen can claim to be as beautiful as the Erawan Falls, a seven-tiered waterfall near Kanchanaburi. Each of the different tiers is accessible via an adventurous jungle trail. At the bottom is a pool of crystal clear water, through which you can see fishes the naked eye and in which visitors are allowed to take a refreshing dip!
sources.shortName: Erawan Falls, Kanchanaburi: Jungle Swimming

sources.snippet: The bus costs 60 Baht for a one-way ticket per person, although the prices may have gone slightly up since we took this bus. You of course want to get back home, so expect to pay at least 120+ Baht to take the local bus from Kanchanaburi to and from Erawan Waterfall.
sources.shortName: How to Visit Erawan Waterfall on a Day Trip in 2024

sources.snippet: The picturesque Erawan Falls, which is situated in the Erawan National Park 52 kilometres northwest of the town, is without a doubt one of the highlights of Kanchanaburi. These falls are named after a Hindu elephant god with three heads.
sources.shortName: Discover the best of Kanchanaburi: waterfalls, history, and culture

sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal Thailand - Things To Do In Bangkok
sources.shortName: 7-Level Waterfall In Kanchanaburi With A Limestone Cave
Erawan Falls - Erawan National Park

places.name: Erawan Falls

reviews.text:
This is a WOW place that you just have to visit. The scenery and many waterfalls are simply stunning. There are 7 levels and I have to say it's hard work in the heat to get to the top and there are some very steep steps and lots of them. It is 1550m to level 7 from the start. If you go here you must try and go all the way to the top if possible.

Couple of things to note:
1. You can not take plastic/glass bottles with you. There is a bottle station that will take them off you to collect on your way down. I would buy a big personal drinks container and fill with water you will need it

2. You can swim in some of the pools but the fish there will have a nibble on you so be warned. They don't bite just nibble at your skin.

I took a private taxi that took me to Erawan Falls, Tiger Temple, Jamjuree (old big tree) and meena cafe he picked us up at 10:00 and dropped us off at a restaurant at 19:00  and this cost us 2000 baht. I have to say this was worth it because the public bus to Erawan was small, old, no air con and basic seats.

Erawan Waterfall is¬†a stunning, multi-tiered waterfall located in Erawan National Park in Kanchanaburi Province, Thailand.¬†It is renowned for its picturesque emerald green pools and seven distinct levels, each offering a unique swimming and exploration experience.¬†The falls are named after the three-headed white elephant of Hindu mythology, with the top tier said to resemble Erawan.

The waterfall cascades down seven levels, each with its own characteristics and swimming opportunities.

The water in the pools is a vibrant turquoise or emerald green color, making for a picturesque scene.

Visitors can swim in the pools at each level, and the higher tiers offer more challenging hikes with steeper trails and beautiful forest scenery.

The park is home to diverse wildlife, including fish that nibble at your feet in the pools.

There are various nature trails, including the Khao Hin Lan Pee Trail, offering a quieter experience and opportunities to explore caves and the surrounding forest.

The first three tiers are relatively easy to access, while the higher tiers require more effort and sturdy shoes for the steeper climbs.

Food is not allowed past the second level, and water bottles may require a refundable deposit to encourage responsible waste disposal.

Erawan Waterfall is a popular destination, so expect to encounter other visitors, especially on weekends.

The area is beautiful,  consists of 7 waterfalls. There are golf carts that can help you get to the first few levels, but after that you're on your own.

It is definitely a hike and you need to be ready to walk/trek and the path is not smooth.

You can swim normally in some of the waterfalls, some only with a life jacket (which you can rent) and some you cannot swim at all.

I recommend renting a life jacket and swimming in the earlier levels, as level 7 is the "pinnacle", but there are small fish there that keep biting you, and no one was comfortable swimming in level 7.

I wish they sold snacks/drinks at the higher levels, because after the early levels there is nothing but the watefalls, and they take your food/drinks at that checkpoint.

It's beautiful,  requires a lot of physical effort,  and it was rather underwhelming overall.
Pictures are better than the reality.

If you want to save money,  stay in Kanchanaburi and just take a bus or a grab to Erawan.

places.address: Tha Kradan, Si Sawat District, Kanchanaburi 71250, Thailand
